2. FACILITIES TO MAINTAIN PROPER TEMPERATURE - Comments: All food establishments that display, prepare, or store potentially hazardous food shall have adequate refrigerated food storage facilities.  The reach in milk refrigerator is holding milk at 50.3 f and the walk in cooler is holding milk at 47.8 f to 50 f. The walkin cooler was adjusted and the temperature dropped to 38 f, cooler not tagged. The reach in cooler was tagged held for inspection until repaired or replaced and inspected by the Chicago Department of Public Health. Fax a tag removal request to (312) 746-4240 when the equipment is ready for re-inspection. | 3. POTENTIALLY HAZARDOUS FOOD MEETS TEMPERATURE REQUIREMENT DURING STORAGE, PREPARATION DISPLAY AND SERVICE - Comments: All cold food shall be stored at a temperature of 40F or less.  Approximately 1000 half pints of milk were found at 47.8 f to 50.3 f internal temperature.  All milk on premises was tagged held for inspection until it expires on June 1, 2010 after which time the milk may be picked up and properly disposed of by the milk vendor.  Approximately 62.5 gallons of milk valued at $220.00 is tagged held for inspection. | 26. ADEQUATE NUMBER, CONVENIENT, ACCESSIBLE, PROPERLY DESIGNED AND INSTALLED - Comments: When toilet and lavatory facilities are provided for the patrons of food establishments, such facilities shall be adequate in number, convenient, accessible, properly designed, and installed according to the municipal code.   Eight out of twelve of the washrooms and the sinks in rooms 105, 113, 202, 207, 213, 215, and 216 have no hot running water. Restore the hot water to all sinks in the building. | 40. REFRIGERATION AND METAL STEM THERMOMETERS PROVIDED AND CONSPICUOUS - Comments: All food establishments that display, prepare, or store potentially hazardous foods shall have calibrated metal stem thermometers, provided and conspicuous, for refrigerated and hot food units.  The cafateria metal stem thermometers were ten and twenty-one degrees off, the thermometers were recalibrated at this time.  Install working thermometers in the classroom refrigerators. | 18. NO EVIDENCE OF RODENT OR INSECT OUTER OPENINGS PROTECTED/RODENT PROOFED, A WRITTEN LOG SHALL BE MAINTAINED AVAILABLE TO THE INSPECTORS - Comments: All necessary control measures shall be used to effectively minimize or eliminate the presence of rodents, roaches, and other vermin and insects on the premises of all food establishments, in food-transporting vehicles, and in vending machines.  Over 50 mouse droppings were found around the perimeters and in the cubbies of rooms 105, 111 and 113. Holes were found in the baseboards next to the attached book cases and the west dock door has 1/4' gaps at the bottom.   Wash, rinse and sanitize the areas where droppings are found and rodent proof all possible gaps and outer entry points.  The pest control reports need to address harborage and pest proofing issues so you can make necessary repairs. | 35.
